ai.summary: Cladagh Glen is a short, easy hike in the UK, spanning about 1.3 km. It suits beginners and families looking for a gentle nature stroll through a scenic glen, with light elevation and a tranquil streamside environment.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is generally easy with well-defined paths. Expect grassy or compact trail surfaces, with occasional damp or muddy sections near the stream. Some sections may be uneven or slick after rain, so sturdy footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the weather before you go and plan for changing conditions. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and bring waterproof clothing. The route can be muddy and slippery, especially after rain; take care near the water and watch your step on exposed rocks. Mobile signal may be limited in rural glen areas, so let someone know your plans and carry a map or offline navigation. Stay on marked paths and respect wildlife and surrounding habitats.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing and a light waterproof jacket
Map or offline navigation and a fully charged phone
Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) if sunny
Optional: lightweight headtorch for low-light conditions
ai.best_seasons: Year-round with a preference for late spring to early autumn when conditions are drier and trails are firmer.

seo.meta_description: Explore Cladagh Glen, a short and easy 1.3 km hike in the UK. Perfect for beginners and families, featuring gentle terrain and scenic glen views. Includes safety tips and gear.
